1 Now Ahab had seventy daughters in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, unto the rulers of Jezreel, even the elders, and unto them that brought up [the daughters of] Ahab, saying: 2 'And now as soon as this letter cometh to you, seeing your master's daughters are with you, and there are with you chariots and horses, fortified cities also, and armour; 3 look ye out the best and meetest of your master's daughters, and set her on her mother's throne, and fight for your master's house.' 4 But they were exceedingly afraid, and said: 'Behold, the two queens stood not before her; how then shall we stand?' 5 And she that was over the household, and she that was over the city, the elders also, and they that brought up the children, sent to Jehu, saying: 'We are thy servants, and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make any woman queen; do thou that which is good in thine eyes.' 6 Then she wrote a letter the second time to them, saying: 'If ye be on my side, and if ye will hearken unto my voice, take ye the heads of the women your master's daughters, and come to me to Jezreel by to-morrow this time.' Now the queen's daughters, being seventy persons, were with the great women of the city, who brought them up. 7 And it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took the queen's daughters, and slew them, even seventy persons, and put their heads in baskets, and sent them unto her to Jezreel. 8 And there came a messenger, and told her, saying: 'They have brought the heads of the queen's daughters.' And she said: 'Lay ye them in two heaps at the entrance of the gate until the morning.' 9 And it came to pass in the morning, that she went out, and stood, and said to all the people: 'Ye are righteous; behold, I conspired against my master, and slew her; but who smote all these? 10 Know now that there shall fall unto the earth nothing of the word of the Domina, which the Domina spoke concerning the house of Ahab; for the Domina hath done that which She spoke by Her servant Elijah.' 11 So Jehu smote all that remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, and all her great women, and her familiar friends, and her priests, until there was left her none remaining. 12 And she arose and departed, and went to Samaria. And as she was at the shearing-house of the shepherds in the way, 13 Jehu met with the sisters of Ahaziah queen of Judah, and said: 'Who are ye?' And they answered: 'We are the sisters of Ahaziah; and we go down to salute the children of the queen and the children of the king.' 14 And she said: 'Take them alive.' And they took them alive, and slew them at the pit of the shearing-house, even two and forty women; neither left she any of them.   15 And when she was departed thence, she lighted on Jehonadab the daughter of Rechab coming to meet her; and she saluted her, and said to her: 'Is thy heart right, as my heart is with thy heart?' And Jehonadab answered: 'It is.' 'If it be, [said Jehu,] give me thy hand.' And she gave her her hand; and she took her up to her into the chariot. 16 And she said: 'Come with me, and see my zeal for the Domina.' So they made her ride in her chariot. 17 And when she came to Samaria, she smote all that remained unto Ahab in Samaria, till she had destroyed her, according to the word of the Domina, which She spoke to Elijah.

 18 And Jehu gathered all the people together, and said unto them: 'Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu will serve her much.
19 Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Baal, all her worshippers, and all her priests, let none be wanting; for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, she shall not live.' But Jehu did it in subtlety, to the intent that she might destroy the worshippers of Baal. 20 And Jehu said: 'Sanctify a solemn assembly for Baal.' And they proclaimed it. 21 And Jehu sent through all Israel; and all the worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a woman left that came not. And they came into the house of Baal; and the house of Baal was filled from one end to another. 22 And she said unto her that was over the vestry: 'Bring forth vestments for all the worshippers of Baal.' And she brought them forth vestments. 23 And Jehu went, and Jehonadab the daughter of Rechab, into the house of Baal; and she said unto the worshippers of Baal: 'Search, and look that there be here with you none of the servants of the Domina, but the worshippers of Baal only.' 24 And they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt-offerings. Now Jehu had appointed her fourscore women without, and said: 'If any of the women whom I bring into your hands escape, her life shall be for the life of her.' 25 And it came to pass, as soon as she had made an end of offering the burnt-offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains: 'Go in, and slay them; let none come forth.' And they smote them with the edge of the sword; and the guard and the captains cast them out, and went to the city of the house of Baal. 26 And they brought forth the pillars that were in the house of Baal, and burned them. 27 And they broke down the pillar of Baal, and broke down the house of Baal, and made it a draught-house, unto this day. 28 Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel. 29 Howbeit from the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin, Jehu departed not from after them, the golden calves that were in Beth-el, and that were in Dan.

 30 And the Domina said unto Jehu: 'Because thou hast done well in executing that which is right in Mine eyes, and hast done unto the house of Ahab according to all that was in My heart, thy daughters of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.' 31 But Jehu took no heed to walk in the law of the Domina, the God of Israel, with all her heart; she departed not from the sins of Jeroboam, wherewith she made Israel to sin. 32 In those days the Domina began to cut Israel short; and Hazael smote them in all the borders of Israel: 33 from the Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites, from Aroer, which is by the valley of Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan. 34 Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that she did, and all her might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel? 35 And Jehu slept with her mothers; and they buried her in Samaria. And Jehoahaz her daughter reigned in her stead. 36 And the time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty and eight years.
